sentences.sContent: This was how I stepped into my twentieth year.
sentences.sCn: 我就是这样地跨进我的二十岁年纪。

sentences.sContent: The four and twentieth to Romamtiezer, he, his sons, and his brethren, were twelve.
sentences.sCn: 第二十四是罗幔提以谢。 他和他儿子并弟兄共十二人。

sentences.sContent: When you know you will have a second, third, or twentieth release it is easy to just add scope to the product backlog. You know you will get to that feature someday.
sentences.sCn: 当你得知你将有第二个、第三个甚至第二十个发布时，它也只是简单地增加产品需求列表的范围，你知道，通过这样做，假以时日就能实现这些特性。

synos.tran: 第二十的；二十分之一的

words.tran: 二十几岁；二十年代（1920年到1929年的时期）；一生中20至29岁的十年

trans.tranOther: the one in a series that you count as number twenty
